intro: Oldenlandia tenuifolia, commonly known as slenderleaf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. It features small, delicate white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often with three stamens. Its leaves are narrow and linear, contributing to its common name, and the plant is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
